In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a Julia function that wraps a string at a specified width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    wrapped_text *= current_line
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage:
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over each word. If adding the current word to the current line would exceed the specified width, it adds the current line to the wrapped text and starts a new line with the current word. Otherwise, it adds the word to the current line. Finally, it adds the last line to the wrapped text and returns it.
